params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the subscription option that was created and event metadata.

docs.summary: Triggered when a subscription option is created.
Triggered when a subscription option is deleted.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the subscription option that was updated and event metadata.

docs.summary: Triggered when a subscription option is changed.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The AppDefId

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: The instance Id

members.name: image
members.doc: Item image.

members.name: name
members.doc: Item name.

members.name: price
members.doc: Item price.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Order creation date and time.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Request ID.

members.name: autoNotified
members.doc:
Whether a notification was created automatically.

If `false`, then the notification was created manually.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc: Catalog and item reference. Includes IDs for the item and the catalog it came from, as well as additional, optional information.

members.name: contactId
members.doc:
Contact ID.

Auto-created if one does not yet exist. For more information, see [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/introduction).

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address to send notification to about item being back in stock.

members.name: itemUrl
members.doc: override default item url returned from the implementer

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the notification.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc: Catalog and item reference. Holds IDs for the item and the catalog it came from.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of unique occurrences of back in stock requests for given CatalogReference.

description: Maps each back in stock CatalogReference to the results (the number of unique occurrences).

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: id
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the catalog app. For items from Wix apps, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `bookingId` for Wix Bookings.

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional info in key:value form. For example, to specify Wix Stores product options or variants:
+ `{"options": {"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}}}`
+ `{"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}}`

description: Used for grouping line items and is sent on add to cart

members.name: itemDetails
members.doc: Item data used in email and chat notifications

members.name: request
members.doc: Notification request data (id is ignored, as it's generated by server)

members.name: request
members.doc: Created BackInStockNotificationRequest

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: BackInStockNotificationRequest id

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: _id
members.doc: BackInStockNotificationRequest id

members.name: request
members.doc: Requested BackInStockNotificationRequest

members.name: catalogReferences
members.doc: Back in stock requests to be counted identified by their CatalogReference.

members.name: countsPerCatalogReference
members.doc: The number of back in stock notifications for each of the catalog references requested.

members.doc: tell us why you're invalidating the cache. You don't need to add your app name

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter object.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For example, `[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: requests
members.doc: Matching BackInStockNotificationRequests

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
Item identifier. All BackInStockNotificationRequests for this item identifier will be processed.
Cannot be used with `request_ids`.

members.name: extraAutomationTemplateParameters
members.doc:
Extra key-value pairs that will be passed to back in stock notification email template
[`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholder values that are taken from item_details field may be overridden by values from this map

members.name: itemDetails
members.doc:
Item data used in email and chat notifications.
Item details values will also be passed into automation template which is used for actual back in stock notification to User of User
(item_details.price will be passed as `item.price`, item_details.name - as `item.name`, item_details.image.url as `item.image.url`
In case when automation template contains only [`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholders,
`extra_automation_template_parameters` may be left empty
In case when automation template is defined without using [`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholders,
values should be passed in `extra_automation_template_parameters`

members.name: requestIds
members.doc:
Identifiers of BackInStockNotificationRequest that need to be handled.
Cannot be used with `catalog_reference`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.name: allowed
members.doc: Pass `true` to offer product by subscription and as one-time purchase. Pass `false` to offer product as subscription only.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: assignedSubscriptionOptions
members.doc: Ordered array of subscription options that will be assigned to the product. Pass an empty array to remove all subscription options from the product.

members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: ids
members.doc: ids of subscription options which will be applied to original price

members.name: prices
members.doc:
Original prices to which subscription options discount will be applied.
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price

members.name: _id
members.doc: Calculation id (product id)

members.name: prices
members.doc:
Original prices to which subscription options discount will be applied.
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price

members.name: subscriptionOptionIds
members.doc: ids of subscription options which will be applied to original price.

members.name: items
members.doc: Original prices to be calculated for each corresponding product id with related subscription plan ids

members.name: calculatedPrices
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option

members.name: _id
members.doc: Calculation id (product id)

members.name: calculatedPrices
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option

members.name: calculatedPricesPerProduct
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option for each product

members.doc: Subscription option ID (auto-generated upon subscription option creation).

members.name: description
members.doc: Subscription option description (optional).

members.name: discount
members.doc:
Discount info (optional).
For example, a $20 discount would be `value: 20`, `type: AMOUNT`.

members.name: subscriptionSettings
members.doc: Subscription charge times. For example, if `frequency: MONTH` and `billingCycles: 6`; payment will be made monthly for 6 months.

members.doc: Whether subscription is renewed automatically at the end of each period.

members.name: billingCycles
members.doc: Number of billing cycles before subscription ends. Ignored if `autoRenewal: true`.

members.doc: Frequency of recurring payment.
